titles.title: Internet Cigarette Warning Label Act
To require the sale and advertisement of cigarettes on the Internet to meet the warning requirements of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications, Trade, and Consumer Protection.

bill.summary: 10/4/1999--Introduced. Internet Cigarette Warning Label Act - Makes it unlawful for any cigarette manufacturer, importer, or retailer to sell or advertise cigarettes through the Internet unless the packages and Internet images contain warning labels required by specified provisions of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act. Requires the Federal Trade Commission to regulate how warnings must appear on the Internet so as to be conspicuous.
